topic.name: Classical Mechanics
topic.definition: Classical mechanics is the study of the motion of bodies under the action of forces, using the laws of Newton as its foundation.

principle.name: Newton's First Law
principle.definition: An object at rest tends to stay at rest, and an object in motion tends to stay in motion with a constant velocity, unless acted upon by a force.

principle.name: Newton's Second Law
principle.definition: The rate of change of momentum of a body is directly proportional to the force applied, and occurs in the direction in which the force is applied.

principle.name: Newton's Third Law
principle.definition: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

topic.name: Thermodynamics
topic.definition: Thermodynamics is the study of the relationships between heat, work, and energy, and the laws that govern the conversion of energy from one form to another.

principle.name: First Law of Thermodynamics
principle.definition: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only converted from one form to another.

principle.name: Second Law of Thermodynamics
principle.definition: Heat cannot naturally flow from a colder body to a hotter body.

principle.name: Third Law of Thermodynamics
principle.definition: As the temperature of a system approaches absolute zero, the entropy of the system approaches a minimum value.
